summary: This module is used to interact with Kafka Brokers via Kafka Consumer and Kafka Producer clients. This module supports Kafka 1.x.x and 2.0.0 versions.
description:
Module Overview

This module is used to interact with Kafka Brokers via Kafka Consumer and Kafka Producer clients. This module supports Kafka 1.x.x and 2.0.0 versions.

For information on the operations, which you can perform with this module, see the below Functions. For examples on the usage of the operations, see the following.

  • Producer Example
  • Consumer Service Example
  • Consumer Client Example
  • Consumer Groups Example
  • Transactional Producer Example

Basic Usages

Publishing Messages

  1. Initialize the Kafka message producer.
kafka:ProducerConfiguration producerConfiguration = {
    bootstrapServers: "localhost:9092",
    clientId: "basic-producer",
    acks: "all",
    retryCount: 3,
    valueSerializerType: kafka:SER_STRING,
    keySerializerType: kafka:SER_INT
};

kafka:Producer kafkaProducer = new (producerConfiguration);
  1. Use the kafka:Producer to publish messages.
string message = "Hello World, Ballerina";
kafka:ProducerError? result = kafkaProducer->send(message, "kafka-topic", key = 1);

Consuming Messages

  1. Initializing the Kafka message consumer.
kafka:ConsumerConfiguration consumerConfiguration = {
    bootstrapServers: "localhost:9092",
    groupId: "group-id",
    offsetReset: "earliest",
    topics: ["kafka-topic"]
};

kafka:Consumer consumer = new (consumerConfiguration);
  1. Use the kafka:Consumer as a simple record consumer.
kafka:ConsumerRecord[]|kafka:ConsumerError result = consumer->poll(1000);
  1. Use the kafka:Consumer as a listener.
listener kafka:Consumer consumer = new (consumerConfiguration);

service kafkaService on consumer {
    // This resource will be executed when a message is published to the
    // subscribed topic/topics.
    resource function onMessage(kafka:Consumer kafkaConsumer,
            kafka:ConsumerRecord[] records) {
    }
}

Send Data Using Avro

The Ballerina Kafka module supports Avro serialization and deserialization.

To try this, create a new Ballerina project and two modules inside it.

Execute the below commands to do this.

ballerina new kafka_avro_sample
cd kafka_avro_sample
ballerina add producer
ballerina add consumer

Dependencies

To use Avro, you need to add the necessary dependencies to the Ballerina project you created. To do so, download the necessary dependencies and add them inside the resources directory. Also, add those dependencies to the Ballerina.toml file of your project. The following is a sample Ballerina.toml file with the dependencies.

    [[platform.libraries]]
    module = "producer"
    path = "./resources/kafka-avro-serializer-5.4.1.jar"
    artifactId = "kafka-avro-serializer"
    version = "5.4.1"
    groupId = "io.confluent"

    [[platform.libraries]]
    module = "producer"
    path = "./resources/kafka-schema-registry-client-5.4.1.jar"
    artifactId = "kafka-schema-registry-client"
    version = "5.4.1"
    groupId = "io.confluent"

    [[platform.libraries]]
    module = "producer"
    path = "./resources/common-config-5.4.1.jar"
    artifactId = "common-config"
    version = "5.4.1"
    groupId = "io.confluent"

    [[platform.libraries]]
    module = "producer"
    path = "./resources/common-utils-5.4.1.jar"
    artifactId = "common-utils"
    version = "5.4.1"
    groupId = "io.confluent"

    [[platform.libraries]]
    module = "producer"
    path = "./resources/avro-1.9.2.jar"
    artifactId = "avro"
    version = "1.9.2"
    groupId = "org.apache.avro"

    [[platform.libraries]]
    module = "producer"
    path = "./resources/jackson-core-2.10.3.jar"
    artifactId = "jackson-core"
    version = "1.9.2"
    groupId = "com.fasterxml.jackson.core"

    [[platform.libraries]]
    module = "producer"
    path = "./resources/jackson-databind-2.10.3.jar"
    artifactId = "jackson-databind"
    version = "2.10.3"
    groupId = "com.fasterxml.jackson.core"

    [[platform.libraries]]
    module = "producer"
    path = "./resources/jackson-annotations-2.10.3.jar"
    artifactId = "jackson-annotations"
    version = "2.10.3"
    groupId = "com.fasterxml.jackson.core"

Now, the directory structure will look like below (some of the files are ignored).

├── Ballerina.toml
├── resources
│   ├── avro-1.9.2.jar
│   ├── common-config-5.4.1.jar
│   ├── common-utils-5.4.1.jar
│   ├── jackson-annotations-2.10.3.jar
│   ├── jackson-core-2.10.3.jar
│   ├── jackson-databind-2.10.3.jar
│   ├── kafka-avro-serializer-5.4.1.jar
│   └── kafka-schema-registry-client-5.4.1.jar
└── src
    ├── consumer
    │   └── main.bal
    └── producer
        └── main.bal

Avro Producer

The kafka:Proucer can be configured to send data using Avro by providing the following configurations.

  • schemaString: This is the schema string, which is used to define the Avro schema.
  • dataRecord: The data record you want to send through Kafka.

src/producer/main.bal:

import ballerina/io;
import ballerina/kafka;

public type Person record {
    string name;
    int age;
};

kafka:ProducerConfiguration configs = {
    bootstrapServers: "<KAFKA_BROKER_HOST_AND_PORT>",
    // Other configurations
    valueSerializerType: kafka:SER_AVRO,
    schemaRegistryUrl: "<SCHEMA_REGISTRY_URL>"
};

string schema = "{\"type\" : \"record\"," +
                  "\"namespace\" : \"Thisaru\"," +
                  "\"name\" : \"person\"," +
                  "\"fields\" : [" + 
                    "{ \"name\" : \"name\", \"type\" : \"string\" }," +
                    "{ \"name\" : \"age\", \"type\" : \"int\" }" +
                  "]}";

public function main() {
    kafka:Producer producer = new(configs);

    Person person = {
        name: "Lahiru Perera",
        age: 28
    };

    kafka:AvroRecord avroRecord = {
        schemaString: schema,
        dataRecord: person
    };

    kafka:ProducerError? result = producer->send(avroRecord, "add-person");
    if (result is kafka:ProducerError) {
        io:println(result);    
    }
}

Avro Consumer

The Kafka implementation of Ballerina currently supports Avro deserialization only for generic records. The Consumer will return a kafka:AvroGenericRecord with the data received from Avro.

The following is a sample consumer.

src/producer/main.bal:

import ballerina/io;
import ballerina/kafka;

kafka:ConsumerConfiguration configs = {
    bootstrapServers: "<KAFKA_BROKER_HOST_AND_PORT>",
    groupId: "test-group",
    // Other configurations
    topics: ["add-person"],
    valueDeserializerType: kafka:DES_AVRO,
    schemaRegistryUrl: "<SCHEMA_REGISTRY_URL>"
};

listener kafka:Consumer consumer = new(configs);

service KafkaService on consumer {
    resource function onMessage(kafka:Consumer consumer, kafka:ConsumerRecord[] records) {
        io:println("Records received");
        foreach var kafkaRecord in records {
            anydata value = kafkaRecord.value;
            if (value is kafka:AvroGenericRecord) {
                io:println(value);
            } else {
                io:println("Invalid record type");
            }
        }
    }
}

Now, execute the below command to run the consumer:

ballerina run consumer

This will start the Kafka service to listen. You can verify it by the following messages, which will be displayed on the screen.

[ballerina/kafka] kafka servers: <KAFKA_BROKER_HOST_AND_PORT>
[ballerina/kafka] subscribed topics: add-person
[ballerina/kafka] started kafka listener

Then, open another terminal and execute the below command to run the producer:

ballerina run producer

Now, the consumer will receive the data and the received data will be printed on the Console as follows.

Records received
name=Lahiru Perera age=28

fields.name: mechanism
fields.description: Type of the authentication mechanism. Currently, SASL_PLAIN and SCRAM are supported. See kafka:AuthennticationType for more information

fields.name: securityProtocol
fields.description: Type of the security protocol to use in the broker connection

fields.name: username
fields.description: The username to use to authenticate the Kafka producer/consumer

fields.name: password
fields.description: The password to use to authenticate the Kafka producer/consumer

records.name: AvroGenericRecord
records.description: Represents a generic Avro record. This is the type of the value returned from an Avro deserializer consumer.

fields.name: schemaString
fields.description: The string, which defines the Avro schema

fields.name: dataRecord
fields.description: Records, which should be serialized using Avro

records.name: AvroRecord
records.description: Defines a record to send data using Avro serialization.

fields.name: bootstrapServers
fields.description: List of remote server endpoints of kafka brokers

fields.name: groupId
fields.description: Unique string that identifies the consumer

fields.name: topics
fields.description: Topics to be subscribed by the consumer

fields.name: offsetReset
fields.description: Offset reset strategy if no initial offset

fields.name: partitionAssignmentStrategy
fields.description: Strategy class for handling the partition assignment among consumers

fields.name: metricsRecordingLevel
fields.description: Metrics recording level

fields.name: metricsReporterClasses
fields.description: Metrics reporter classes

fields.name: clientId
fields.description: Identifier to be used for server side logging

fields.name: interceptorClasses
fields.description: Interceptor classes to be used before sending records

fields.name: isolationLevel
fields.description: Transactional message reading method

fields.name: keyDeserializerType
fields.description: Deserializer used for the Kafka record key. This should be a kafka:DeserializerType

fields.name: valueDeserializerType
fields.description: Deserializer used for the Kafka record value. This should be a kafka:DeserializerType

fields.name: keyDeserializer
fields.description: Custom deserializer object to deserialize kafka keys. This should be implement the kafka:Deserializer object

fields.name: valueDeserializer
fields.description: Custom deserializer object to deserialize kafka values. This should implement the kafka:Deserializer object

fields.name: schemaRegistryUrl
fields.description: Avro schema registry url. Use this field to specify schema registry url, if Avro serializer is used

fields.name: properties
fields.description: Additional properties for the property fields not provided by Ballerina Kafka module. Use this with caution since this can override any of the fields. It is not recomendded to use this field except in an extreme situation

fields.name: sessionTimeoutInMillis
fields.description: Timeout used to detect consumer failures when heartbeat threshold is reached

fields.name: heartBeatIntervalInMillis
fields.description: Expected time between heartbeats

fields.name: metadataMaxAgeInMillis
fields.description: Maximum time to force a refresh of metadata

fields.name: autoCommitIntervalInMillis
fields.description: Auto committing interval for commit offset, when auto-commit is enabled

fields.name: maxPartitionFetchBytes
fields.description: The maximum amount of data per-partition the server returns

fields.name: sendBuffer
fields.description: Size of the TCP send buffer (SO_SNDBUF)

fields.name: receiveBuffer
fields.description: Size of the TCP receive buffer (SO_RCVBUF)

fields.name: fetchMinBytes
fields.description: Minimum amount of data the server should return for a fetch request

fields.name: fetchMaxBytes
fields.description: Maximum amount of data the server should return for a fetch request

fields.name: fetchMaxWaitTimeInMillis
fields.description: Maximum amount of time the server will block before answering the fetch request

fields.name: reconnectBackoffTimeMaxInMillis
fields.description: Maximum amount of time in milliseconds to wait when reconnecting

fields.name: retryBackoffInMillis
fields.description: Time to wait before attempting to retry a failed request

fields.name: metricsSampleWindowInMillis
fields.description: Window of time a metrics sample is computed over

fields.name: metricsNumSamples
fields.description: Number of samples maintained to compute metrics

fields.name: requestTimeoutInMillis
fields.description: Wait time for response of a request

fields.name: connectionMaxIdleTimeInMillis
fields.description: Close idle connections after the number of milliseconds

fields.name: maxPollRecords
fields.description: Maximum number of records returned in a single call to poll

fields.name: maxPollInterval
fields.description: Maximum delay between invocations of poll

fields.name: reconnectBackoffTimeInMillis
fields.description: Time to wait before attempting to reconnect

fields.name: pollingTimeoutInMillis
fields.description: Timeout interval for polling

fields.name: pollingIntervalInMillis
fields.description: Polling interval for the consumer

fields.name: concurrentConsumers
fields.description: Number of concurrent consumers

fields.name: defaultApiTimeoutInMillis
fields.description: Default API timeout value for APIs with duration

fields.name: autoCommit
fields.description: Enables auto committing offsets

fields.name: checkCRCS
fields.description: Check the CRC32 of the records consumed. This ensures that no on-the-wire or on-disk corruption to the messages occurred. This may add some overhead, and might needed set to false if extreme performance is required

fields.name: excludeInternalTopics
fields.description: Whether records from internal topics should be exposed to the consumer

fields.name: decoupleProcessing
fields.description: Decouples processing

fields.name: secureSocket
fields.description: Configurations related to SSL/TLS encryption

fields.name: authenticationConfiguration
fields.description: Authentication-related configurations for the Kafka consumer

fields.name: key
fields.description: Key that is included in the record

fields.name: value
fields.description: Record content

fields.name: offset
fields.description: Offset value

fields.name: partition
fields.description: Partition in which the record is stored

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: Timestamp of the record, in milliseconds since epoch

fields.name: topic
fields.description: Topic to which the record belongs to

fields.name: keyStoreType
fields.description: The file format of the KeyStore file. This is optional for the client

fields.name: location
fields.description: The location of the KeyStore file. This is optional for the client and can be used for two-way authentication for the client

fields.name: password
fields.description: The store password for the KeyStore file. This is optional for the client and is only needed if the ssl.keystore.location is configured

fields.name: keyManagerAlgorithm
fields.description: The algorithm used by the key manager factory for SSL connections. The default value is the key manager factory algorithm configured for the JVM

fields.name: partition
fields.description: The kafka:TopicPartition to which the record is related

fields.name: offset
fields.description: Offset in which the record is stored in the partition

records.name: PartitionOffset
records.description: Represents the topic partition position in which the consumed record is stored.

fields.name: bootstrapServers
fields.description: List of remote server endpoints of Kafka brokers

fields.name: acks
fields.description: Number of acknowledgments

fields.name: compressionType
fields.description: Compression type to be used for messages

fields.name: clientId
fields.description: Identifier to be used for server side logging

fields.name: metricsRecordingLevel
fields.description: Metrics recording level

fields.name: metricReporterClasses
fields.description: Metrics reporter classes

fields.name: partitionerClass
fields.description: Partitioner class to be used to select the partition to which the message is sent

fields.name: interceptorClasses
fields.description: Interceptor classes to be used before sending records

fields.name: transactionalId
fields.description: Transactional ID to be used in transactional delivery

fields.name: valueSerializerType
fields.description: Serializer used for the Kafka record value. This can be either kafka:SerializerType or a user-defined serializer

fields.name: keySerializerType
fields.description: Serializer used for the Kafka record key. This can be either kafka:SerializerType or a user-defined serializer

fields.name: valueSerializer
fields.description: Custom serializer object to serialize Kafka values. This should implement the kafka:Serializer object

fields.name: keySerializer
fields.description: Custom serializer object to serialize Kafka keys. This should implement the kafka:Serializer object

fields.name: schemaRegistryUrl
fields.description: Avro schema registry URL. Use this field to specify the schema registry URL if the Avro serializer is used

fields.name: properties
fields.description: Additional properties for the property fields not provided by Ballerina Kafka module. Use this with caution since this can override any of the fields. It is not recomendded to use this field except in an extreme situation

fields.name: bufferMemory
fields.description: Total bytes of memory the producer can use to buffer records

fields.name: retryCount
fields.description: Number of retries to resend a record

fields.name: batchSize
fields.description: Number of records to be batched for a single request. Use 0 for no batching

fields.name: linger
fields.description: Delay to allow other records to be batched

fields.name: sendBuffer
fields.description: Size of the TCP send buffer (SO_SNDBUF)

fields.name: receiveBuffer
fields.description: Size of the TCP receive buffer (SO_RCVBUF)

fields.name: maxRequestSize
fields.description: The maximum size of a request in bytes

fields.name: reconnectBackoffTimeInMillis
fields.description: Time to wait before attempting to reconnect

fields.name: reconnectBackoffMaxTimeInMillis
fields.description: Maximum amount of time in milliseconds to wait when reconnecting

fields.name: retryBackoffTimeInMillis
fields.description: Time to wait before attempting to retry a failed request

fields.name: maxBlock
fields.description: Maximum block time during which the sending is blocked when the buffer is full

fields.name: requestTimeoutInMillis
fields.description: Wait time for the response of a request

fields.name: metadataMaxAgeInMillis
fields.description: Maximum time to force a refresh of metadata

fields.name: metricsSampleWindowInMillis
fields.description: Time window for a metrics sample to compute over

fields.name: metricsNumSamples
fields.description: Number of samples maintained to compute the metrics

fields.name: maxInFlightRequestsPerConnection
fields.description: Maximum number of unacknowledged requests on a single connection

fields.name: connectionsMaxIdleTimeInMillis
fields.description: Close the idle connections after this number of milliseconds

fields.name: transactionTimeoutInMillis
fields.description: Timeout for transaction status update from the producer

fields.name: enableIdempotence
fields.description: Exactly one copy of each message is written to the stream when enabled

fields.name: secureSocket
fields.description: Configurations related to SSL/TLS encryption

fields.name: authenticationConfiguration
fields.description: Authentication-related configurations for the Kafka producer

fields.name: securityProtocol
fields.description: The protocol used to communicate with brokers.

fields.name: sslProtocol
fields.description: The SSL protocol used to generate the SSLContext. The default setting is TLS, which is fine for most cases. Allowed values in recent JVMs are TLS, TLSv1.1, and TLSv1.2. Also, SSL, SSLv2 and SSLv3 may be supported in older JVMs but their usage is discouraged due to known security vulnerabilities

fields.name: sslProtocolVersions
fields.description: The list of protocols enabled for SSL connections

records.name: Protocols
records.description: Configurations related to the SSL/TLS protocol and the versions to be used.

fields.name: keyStore
fields.description: Configurations associated with the KeyStore

fields.name: trustStore
fields.description: Configurations associated with the TrustStore

fields.name: protocol
fields.description: Configurations related to the SSL/TLS protocol and the version to be used

fields.name: sslProvider
fields.description: The name of the security provider used for SSL connections. Default value is the default security provider of the JVM

fields.name: sslKeyPassword
fields.description: The password of the private key in the key store file. This is optional for the client

fields.name: sslCipherSuites
fields.description: A list of Cipher suites. This is a named combination of the authentication, encryption, MAC, and key exchange algorithms used to negotiate the security settings for a network connection using the TLS or SSL network protocols. By default, all the available Cipher suites are supported

fields.name: sslEndpointIdentificationAlgorithm
fields.description: The endpoint identification algorithm to validate the server hostname using the server certificate

fields.name: sslSecureRandomImplementation
fields.description: The SecureRandom PRNG implementation to use for the SSL cryptography operations

records.name: SecureSocket
records.description: Configurations for facilitating secure communication with the Kafka server.

fields.name: topic
fields.description: Topic to which the partition is related

fields.name: partition
fields.description: Index for the partition

fields.name: trustStoreType
fields.description: The file format of the TrustStore file

fields.name: location
fields.description: The location of the TrustStore file

fields.name: password
fields.description: The password for the TrustStore file. If a password is not set, access to the TrustStore is still available but integrity checking is disabled

fields.name: trustManagerAlgorithm
fields.description: The algorithm used by the trust manager factory for SSL connections. The default value is the trust manager factory algorithm configured for the JVM

objects.name: Deserializer
objects.description: Represents a Kafka deserializer object. This object can be used to create custom deserializers for Ballerina Kafka consumers.

objects.name: Serializer
objects.description: Represents a Kafka serializer object. This object can be used to create custom serializers for the Ballerina Kafka producers.

parameters.name: partitions
parameters.description: Topic partitions to be assigned

returnParameters.description: kafka:ConsumerError if an error is encountered or else nil

remoteMethods.name: assign
remoteMethods.description: Assigns consumer to a set of topic partitions.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Timeout duration for the close operation execution

returnParameters.description: A kafka:ConsumerError if an error is encountered or else '()'

remoteMethods.name: close
remoteMethods.description:
Closes the consumer connection of the external Kafka broker.

 kafka:ConsumerError? result = consumer->close();

returnParameters.description: A kafka:ConsumerError if an error is encountered or else '()'

remoteMethods.name: commit
remoteMethods.description:
Commits the current consumed offsets for the consumer.

 kafka:ConsumerError? result = consumer->commit();

parameters.name: offsets
parameters.description: Offsets to be commited

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Timeout duration for the commit operation execution

returnParameters.description: kafka:ConsumerError if an error is encountered or else nil

remoteMethods.name: commitOffset
remoteMethods.description: Commits given offsets and partitions for the given topics, for consumer.

returnParameters.description: A kafka:ConsumerError if an error is encountered or else '()'

remoteMethods.name: connect
remoteMethods.description:
Connects the consumer to the provided host in the consumer configs.

 kafka:ConsumerError? result = consumer->connect();

returnParameters.description: Array of assigned partitions for the consumer if executes successfully or else a kafka:ConsumerError

remoteMethods.name: getAssignment
remoteMethods.description:
Retrieves the currently-assigned partitions for the consumer.

 kafka:TopicPartition[]|kafka:ConsumerError result = consumer->getAssignment();

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Timeout duration for the execution of the get available topics operation

returnParameters.description: Array of topics currently available (authorized) for the consumer to subscribe or else a kafka:ConsumerError

remoteMethods.name: getAvailableTopics
remoteMethods.description:
Retrieves the available list of topics for a particular consumer.

 string[]|kafka:ConsumerError result = consumer->getAvailableTopics();

parameters.name: partitions
parameters.description: Array of topic partitions to get the starting offsets

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Timeout duration for the get beginning offsets execution

returnParameters.description: Starting offsets for the given partitions if executes successfully or else kafka:ConsumerError

remoteMethods.name: getBeginningOffsets
remoteMethods.description: Retrieves the start offsets for given set of partitions.

parameters.name: partition
parameters.description: The TopicPartition in which the committed offset is returned for consumer

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Timeout duration for the get committed offset operation to execute

returnParameters.description: Committed offset for the consumer for the given partition if executes successfully or else kafka:ConsumerError

remoteMethods.name: getCommittedOffset
remoteMethods.description: Retrieves the last committed offsets for the given topic partitions.

parameters.name: partitions
parameters.description: Set of partitions to get the last offsets

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Timeout duration for the get end offsets operation to execute

returnParameters.description: End offsets for the given partitions if executes successfully or else kafka:ConsumerError

remoteMethods.name: getEndOffsets
remoteMethods.description: Retrieves the last offsets for given set of partitions.

returnParameters.description: Set of partitions paused from message retrieval if executes successfully or else a kafka:ConsumerError

remoteMethods.name: getPausedPartitions
remoteMethods.description:
Retrieves the partitions, which are currently paused.

 kafka:TopicPartition[]|kafka:ConsumerError result = consumer->getPausedPartitions();

parameters.name: partition
parameters.description: The TopicPartition in which the position is required

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Timeout duration for the get position offset operation to execute

returnParameters.description: Offset which will be fetched next (if a records exists in that offset) or else kafka:ConsumerError if the operation fails

remoteMethods.name: getPositionOffset
remoteMethods.description: Retrieves the offset of the next record that will be fetched, if a records exists in that position.

returnParameters.description: Array of subscribed topics for the consumer if executes successfully or else a kafka:ConsumerError

remoteMethods.name: getSubscription
remoteMethods.description:
Retrieves the set of topics, which are currently subscribed by the consumer.

 string[]|kafka:ConsumerError result = consumer->getSubscription();

parameters.name: topic
parameters.description: The topic for which the partition information is needed

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Timeout duration for the get topic partitions operation to execute

returnParameters.description: Array of partitions for the given topic if executes successfully or else a kafka:ConsumerError

remoteMethods.name: getTopicPartitions
remoteMethods.description:
Retrieves the set of partitions to which the topic belongs.

 kafka:TopicPartition[]|kafka:ConsumerError result = consumer->getTopicPartitions("kafka-topic");

parameters.name: partitions
parameters.description: Partitions to pause the retrieval of messages

returnParameters.description: kafka:ConsumerError if an error is encountered or else nil

remoteMethods.name: pause
remoteMethods.description: Pauses retrieving messages from a set of partitions.

parameters.name: timeoutValue
parameters.description: Polling time in milliseconds

returnParameters.description: Array of consumer records if executed successfully or else a kafka:ConsumerError

remoteMethods.name: poll
remoteMethods.description:
Polls the consumer for the records of an external broker.

 kafka:ConsumerRecord[]|kafka:ConsumerError result = consumer->poll(1000);

parameters.name: partitions
parameters.description: Partitions to resume the retrieval of messages

returnParameters.description: kafka:ConsumerError if an error is encountered or else ()

remoteMethods.name: resume
remoteMethods.description: Resumes consumer retrieving messages from set of partitions which were paused earlier.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The PartitionOffset to seek

returnParameters.description: kafka:ConsumerError if an error is encountered or else ()

remoteMethods.name: seek
remoteMethods.description: Seeks for a given offset in a topic partition.

parameters.name: partitions
parameters.description: The set of topic partitions to seek

returnParameters.description: kafka:ConsumerError if an error is encountered or else ()

remoteMethods.name: seekToBeginning
remoteMethods.description: Seeks the beginning of the offsets for the given set of topic partitions.

parameters.name: partitions
parameters.description: The set of topic partitions to seek

returnParameters.description: kafka:ConsumerError if an error is encountered or else ()

remoteMethods.name: seekToEnd
remoteMethods.description: Seeks end of the offsets for the given set of topic partitions.

parameters.name: topics
parameters.description: Array of topics to be subscribed to

returnParameters.description: A kafka:ConsumerError if an error is encountered or else '()'

remoteMethods.name: subscribe
remoteMethods.description:
Subscribes the consumer to the provided set of topics.

 kafka:ConsumerError? result = consumer->subscribe(["kafka-topic-1", "kafka-topic-2"]);

parameters.name: regex
parameters.description: Pattern, which should be matched with the topics to be subscribed to

returnParameters.description: A kafka:ConsumerError if an error is encountered or else '()'

remoteMethods.name: subscribeToPattern
remoteMethods.description:
Subscribes the consumer to the topics, which match the provided pattern.

 kafka:ConsumerError? result = consumer->subscribeToPattern("kafka.*");

parameters.name: topics
parameters.description: Array of topics to be subscribed to

parameters.name: onPartitionsRevoked
parameters.description: Function which will be executed if partitions are revoked from this consumer

parameters.name: onPartitionsAssigned
parameters.description: Function which will be executed if partitions are assigned this consumer

returnParameters.description: kafka:ConsumerError if an error is encountered or else ()

remoteMethods.name: subscribeWithPartitionRebalance
remoteMethods.description: Subscribes to the provided set of topics with rebalance listening enabled. This function can be used inside a service, to subscribe to a set of topics, while rebalancing the patition assignment of the consumers.

returnParameters.description: A kafka:ConsumerError if an error is encountered or else '()'

remoteMethods.name: unsubscribe
remoteMethods.description:
Unsubscribes from all the topic subscriptions.

 kafka:ConsumerError? result = consumer->unsubscribe();

fields.name: consumerConfig
fields.description: Used to store configurations related to a Kafka connection

parameters.name: config
parameters.description: Configurations related to consumer endpoint

methods.name: init
methods.description: Creates a new Kafka Consumer.

returnParameters.description: An kafka:ConsumerError if an error is encountered while starting the server or else nil

methods.name: __start
methods.description: Starts the registered services.

returnParameters.description: An kafka:ConsumerError if an error is encountered during the listener stopping process or else nil

methods.name: __gracefulStop
methods.description: Stops the kafka listener.

returnParameters.description: An kafka:ConsumerError if an error is encountered during the listener stopping process or else nil

methods.name: __immediateStop
methods.description: Stops the kafka listener.

parameters.name: s
parameters.description: The service to be attached

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the service

returnParameters.description: An kafka:ConsumerError if an error is encountered while attaching the service or else nil

methods.name: __attach
methods.description: Gets called every time a service attaches itself to the listener.

parameters.name: s
parameters.description: The service to be detached

returnParameters.description: An kafka:ConsumerError if an error is encountered while detaching a service or else nil

methods.name: __detach
methods.description: Detaches a consumer service from the listener.

parameters.name: partitions
parameters.description: Topic partitions to be assigned

returnParameters.description: kafka:ConsumerError if an error is encountered or else nil

methods.name: assign
methods.description: Assigns consumer to a set of topic partitions.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Timeout duration for the close operation execution

returnParameters.description: A kafka:ConsumerError if an error is encountered or else '()'

methods.name: close
methods.description:
Closes the consumer connection of the external Kafka broker.

 kafka:ConsumerError? result = consumer->close();

returnParameters.description: A kafka:ConsumerError if an error is encountered or else '()'

methods.name: commit
methods.description:
Commits the current consumed offsets for the consumer.

 kafka:ConsumerError? result = consumer->commit();

parameters.name: offsets
parameters.description: Offsets to be commited

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Timeout duration for the commit operation execution

returnParameters.description: kafka:ConsumerError if an error is encountered or else nil

methods.name: commitOffset
methods.description: Commits given offsets and partitions for the given topics, for consumer.

returnParameters.description: A kafka:ConsumerError if an error is encountered or else '()'

methods.name: connect
methods.description:
Connects the consumer to the provided host in the consumer configs.

 kafka:ConsumerError? result = consumer->connect();

returnParameters.description: Array of assigned partitions for the consumer if executes successfully or else a kafka:ConsumerError

methods.name: getAssignment
methods.description:
Retrieves the currently-assigned partitions for the consumer.

 kafka:TopicPartition[]|kafka:ConsumerError result = consumer->getAssignment();

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Timeout duration for the execution of the get available topics operation

returnParameters.description: Array of topics currently available (authorized) for the consumer to subscribe or else a kafka:ConsumerError

methods.name: getAvailableTopics
methods.description:
Retrieves the available list of topics for a particular consumer.

 string[]|kafka:ConsumerError result = consumer->getAvailableTopics();

parameters.name: partitions
parameters.description: Array of topic partitions to get the starting offsets

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Timeout duration for the get beginning offsets execution

returnParameters.description: Starting offsets for the given partitions if executes successfully or else kafka:ConsumerError

methods.name: getBeginningOffsets
methods.description: Retrieves the start offsets for given set of partitions.

parameters.name: partition
parameters.description: The TopicPartition in which the committed offset is returned for consumer

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Timeout duration for the get committed offset operation to execute

returnParameters.description: Committed offset for the consumer for the given partition if executes successfully or else kafka:ConsumerError

methods.name: getCommittedOffset
methods.description: Retrieves the last committed offsets for the given topic partitions.

parameters.name: partitions
parameters.description: Set of partitions to get the last offsets

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Timeout duration for the get end offsets operation to execute

returnParameters.description: End offsets for the given partitions if executes successfully or else kafka:ConsumerError

methods.name: getEndOffsets
methods.description: Retrieves the last offsets for given set of partitions.

returnParameters.description: Set of partitions paused from message retrieval if executes successfully or else a kafka:ConsumerError

methods.name: getPausedPartitions
methods.description:
Retrieves the partitions, which are currently paused.

 kafka:TopicPartition[]|kafka:ConsumerError result = consumer->getPausedPartitions();

parameters.name: partition
parameters.description: The TopicPartition in which the position is required

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Timeout duration for the get position offset operation to execute

returnParameters.description: Offset which will be fetched next (if a records exists in that offset) or else kafka:ConsumerError if the operation fails

methods.name: getPositionOffset
methods.description: Retrieves the offset of the next record that will be fetched, if a records exists in that position.

returnParameters.description: Array of subscribed topics for the consumer if executes successfully or else a kafka:ConsumerError

methods.name: getSubscription
methods.description:
Retrieves the set of topics, which are currently subscribed by the consumer.

 string[]|kafka:ConsumerError result = consumer->getSubscription();

parameters.name: topic
parameters.description: The topic for which the partition information is needed

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Timeout duration for the get topic partitions operation to execute

returnParameters.description: Array of partitions for the given topic if executes successfully or else a kafka:ConsumerError

methods.name: getTopicPartitions
methods.description:
Retrieves the set of partitions to which the topic belongs.

 kafka:TopicPartition[]|kafka:ConsumerError result = consumer->getTopicPartitions("kafka-topic");

parameters.name: partitions
parameters.description: Partitions to pause the retrieval of messages

returnParameters.description: kafka:ConsumerError if an error is encountered or else nil

methods.name: pause
methods.description: Pauses retrieving messages from a set of partitions.

parameters.name: timeoutValue
parameters.description: Polling time in milliseconds

returnParameters.description: Array of consumer records if executed successfully or else a kafka:ConsumerError

methods.name: poll
methods.description:
Polls the consumer for the records of an external broker.

 kafka:ConsumerRecord[]|kafka:ConsumerError result = consumer->poll(1000);

parameters.name: partitions
parameters.description: Partitions to resume the retrieval of messages

returnParameters.description: kafka:ConsumerError if an error is encountered or else ()

methods.name: resume
methods.description: Resumes consumer retrieving messages from set of partitions which were paused earlier.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The PartitionOffset to seek

returnParameters.description: kafka:ConsumerError if an error is encountered or else ()

methods.name: seek
methods.description: Seeks for a given offset in a topic partition.

parameters.name: partitions
parameters.description: The set of topic partitions to seek

returnParameters.description: kafka:ConsumerError if an error is encountered or else ()

methods.name: seekToBeginning
methods.description: Seeks the beginning of the offsets for the given set of topic partitions.

parameters.name: partitions
parameters.description: The set of topic partitions to seek

returnParameters.description: kafka:ConsumerError if an error is encountered or else ()

methods.name: seekToEnd
methods.description: Seeks end of the offsets for the given set of topic partitions.

parameters.name: topics
parameters.description: Array of topics to be subscribed to

returnParameters.description: A kafka:ConsumerError if an error is encountered or else '()'

methods.name: subscribe
methods.description:
Subscribes the consumer to the provided set of topics.

 kafka:ConsumerError? result = consumer->subscribe(["kafka-topic-1", "kafka-topic-2"]);

parameters.name: regex
parameters.description: Pattern, which should be matched with the topics to be subscribed to

returnParameters.description: A kafka:ConsumerError if an error is encountered or else '()'

methods.name: subscribeToPattern
methods.description:
Subscribes the consumer to the topics, which match the provided pattern.

 kafka:ConsumerError? result = consumer->subscribeToPattern("kafka.*");

parameters.name: topics
parameters.description: Array of topics to be subscribed to

parameters.name: onPartitionsRevoked
parameters.description: Function which will be executed if partitions are revoked from this consumer

parameters.name: onPartitionsAssigned
parameters.description: Function which will be executed if partitions are assigned this consumer

returnParameters.description: kafka:ConsumerError if an error is encountered or else ()

methods.name: subscribeWithPartitionRebalance
methods.description: Subscribes to the provided set of topics with rebalance listening enabled. This function can be used inside a service, to subscribe to a set of topics, while rebalancing the patition assignment of the consumers.

Unsubscribes from all the topic subscriptions.

 kafka:ConsumerError? result = consumer->unsubscribe();

returnParameters.description: A kafka:ProducerError if closing the producer failed or else '()'

remoteMethods.name: close
remoteMethods.description:
Closes the producer connection to the external Kafka broker.

 kafka:ProducerError? result = producer->close();

parameters.name: consumer
parameters.description: Consumer, which needs offsets to be committed

returnParameters.description: Akafka:ProducerError if committing the consumer failed or else ()

remoteMethods.name: commitConsumer
remoteMethods.description: Commits the offsets consumed by the provided consumer.

parameters.description: Consumer offsets to commit for a given transaction

parameters.name: groupID
parameters.description: Consumer group ID

returnParameters.description: A kafka:ProducerError if committing consumer offsets failed or else ()

remoteMethods.name: commitConsumerOffsets
remoteMethods.description: Commits the consumer offsets in a given transaction.

returnParameters.description: A kafka:ProducerError if records couldn't be flushed or else '()'

remoteMethods.name: flushRecords
remoteMethods.description:
Flushes the batch of records already sent to the broker by the producer.

 kafka:ProducerError? result = producer->flushRecords();

parameters.name: topic
parameters.description: Topic of which the partition information is given

returnParameters.description: A kafka:TopicPartition array for the given topic or else a kafka:ProducerError if the operation fails

remoteMethods.description:
Retrieves the topic partition information for the provided topic.

 kafka:TopicPartition[]|kafka:ProducerError result = producer->getTopicPartitions("kafka-topic");

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: Record contents

parameters.name: topic
parameters.description: Topic to which the record will be appended

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Key, which will be included in the record

parameters.name: partition
parameters.description: Partition to which the record should be sent

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: Timestamp of the record in milliseconds since epoch

returnParameters.description: A kafka:ProducerError if send action fails to send data or else '()'

remoteMethods.name: send
remoteMethods.description:
Produces records to the Kafka server.

 kafka:ProducerError? result = producer->send("Hello World, Ballerina", "kafka-topic");

parameters.name: config
parameters.description: Configurations related to initializing a Kafka Producer

constants.name: ISOLATION_COMMITTED
constants.description: Configures the consumer to read the committed messages only in the transactional mode when poll() is called.

constants.name: ISOLATION_UNCOMMITTED
constants.description: Configures the consumer to read all the messages including the aborted ones.

constants.name: ACKS_ALL
constants.description: Producer acknowledgement type is 'all'. This will guarantee that the record will not be lost as long as at least one in-sync replica is alive.

constants.name: ACKS_NONE
constants.description: Producer acknowledgement type '0'. If the acknowledgement type set to this, the producer will not wait for any acknowledgement from the server.

constants.name: ACKS_SINGLE
constants.description: Producer acknowledgement type '1'. If the acknowledgement type set to this, the leader will write the record to its A local log will respond without waiting FOR full acknowledgement from all the followers.

errors.name: ConsumerError
errors.description: Error type specific to the kafka:Consumer object functions.

errors.name: ProducerError
errors.description: Error type specific to the kafka:Producer object functions.

unionTypes.name: AuthenticationMechanism
unionTypes.description: Represents the supported Kafka SASL authentication mechanisms.

unionTypes.name: CompressionType
unionTypes.description: Kafka compression types to compress the messages.

unionTypes.name: SecurityProtocol
unionTypes.description: Represents the supported security protocols for Kafka clients.
